Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Interface ILogger

All Known Implementing Classes:
TSimpleLogger
public interface ILogger
Simple (maybe too simple in this release) interface used by other TombolaLib objects to trace their activities both during the card series generation phase (ISetFactory objects) and the simulated/assisted tombola games (TGame objects). An interface is used to let TombolaLib users to provide their custom implementation of ILogger objects. Currently the library provide a first practical implementation (see TSimpleLogger) to log on plain text files or on standard console output.
Since:
1.8
Version:
1.1
Author:
Harry G. Potter harry.g.potter@gmail.com
See Also:
ISetFactory, TGame, TSimpleLogger

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Interface Description
    static class  ILogger.TLogLevel
    As usual, define the discrete "levels" of importance for messages passed to Ilogger instances, in order to prioritize them and decide if they must be logged or not based on the log level set for each logger.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void error​(java.lang.String msg)
    Send the msg string to the logger with a default log level set to TLogLevel.ERROR.
    void fatal​(java.lang.String msg)
    Send the msg string to the logger with a default log level set to TLogLevel.FATAL.
    ILogger.TLogLevel getLevel()
    Return the "level" up to the log messages passed to this logger will be traced (that is, saved on a file, printed, stored on a database).
    void info​(java.lang.String msg)
    Send the msg string to the logger with a default log level set to TLogLevel.INFO.
    void log​(ILogger.TLogLevel level, java.lang.String msg)
    Send the msg string to the logger using the specified level of attention. The message will be traced only if the log level of the logger is higher or equal to the log level of the message.
    void setLevel​(ILogger.TLogLevel level)
    Change the level for this ILogger objects: only messages with a TLogLevel higher or equal to the TLogLevel of the ILogger will be written/traced.
    void verbose​(java.lang.String msg)
    Send the msg string to the logger with a default log level set to TLogLevel.VERBOSE.
    void warning​(java.lang.String msg)
    Send the msg string to the logger with a default log level set to TLogLevel.WARNING.

  • Method Details

    • setLevel

      void setLevel​(ILogger.TLogLevel level)
      Change the level for this ILogger objects: only messages with a TLogLevel higher or equal to the TLogLevel of the ILogger will be written/traced.
      Parameters:
      level - maximum level of messages that will be traced by this logger object.

    • getLevel

      ILogger.TLogLevel getLevel()
      Return the "level" up to the log messages passed to this logger will be traced (that is, saved on a file, printed, stored on a database).
      Returns:
      the current LogLevel set for this ILogger object

    • info

      void info​(java.lang.String msg)
      Send the msg string to the logger with a default log level set to TLogLevel.INFO.
      Parameters:
      msg - The text message you want to log.

    • warning

      void warning​(java.lang.String msg)
      Send the msg string to the logger with a default log level set to TLogLevel.WARNING.
      Parameters:
      msg - The text message you want to log.

    • error

      void error​(java.lang.String msg)
      Send the msg string to the logger with a default log level set to TLogLevel.ERROR.
      Parameters:
      msg - The text message you want to log.

    • fatal

      void fatal​(java.lang.String msg)
      Send the msg string to the logger with a default log level set to TLogLevel.FATAL.
      Parameters:
      msg - The text message you want to log.

    • verbose

      void verbose​(java.lang.String msg)
      Send the msg string to the logger with a default log level set to TLogLevel.VERBOSE.
      Parameters:
      msg - The text message you want to log.

    • log

      void log​(ILogger.TLogLevel level, java.lang.String msg)
      Send the msg string to the logger using the specified level of attention. The message will be traced only if the log level of the logger is higher or equal to the log level of the message.
      Parameters:
      level - The level of attention you want to use for this specific message.
      msg - The text message you want to log.
